entries.femaleVariant: Oh hey, Night City. Funny seeing you here. Oh, speakin' of funny, got some hot news for ya.
You know the Tricentennial Monument? That huge, marble phallus getting erected in D.C., the one to mark 300 years of independence?
Well I just got word a hurricane dropped it over before they could even finish it off.
Can you imagine a better metaphor for today's America? 'Cause for the life of me, I cannot.
Actually, no... Saburo Arasaka's handsome mug chiseled into Mount Rushmore. That'd do it.
Now, thought maybe I'd take this chance to deliver my own sort of, y'know, State of the Union.
Nearly 100 million people live in America â€“ half of them below the poverty line. And no, by "poverty line" I do not mean the Tex-Mex border.
The NUSA currently flexes its muscles as the 24th largest economy in the world, alongside other heavyweights such as Myanmar, Qumumbo and Malawi.
One of those names I made up, but I bet y'all don't know which, am I right? Ahh, the American education in action.
All right, OK, but seriously. Twenty-three percent of people in the NUS can't read or write and fifty-two have difficulty. Only thirty-three percent are fully literate.
Those numbers don't add up to a hundred, but I'm guessing you didn't notice that either, did ya? Turns out the majority Americans are just as bad with arithmetic as they are with geography.
Just so we're clear, "majority" means more than half.
Now, the average life-expectancy of Americans is 58. Not too bad, eh? But if we look at the median, then--
Actually, I'm sorry, I'm getting word from my producer that if I start explaining what a "median" is we will lose most of our viewer base.
So, I think it's time for my final word. And I will try to keep it as simple as possible.
We are fucked, America. And I don't know how we're gonna fix it.
Until next time, you beautiful idiots.
